use_cases.title: Attempt signup with a previously registered email
use_cases.goal: To verify the system rejects a signup attempt with an email already registered in the system
preconditions: The email address user@example.com is already registered in the system
steps: Enter the email address 'user@example.com' and password 'SecurePass123!'
expected_results: Display error message: 'This email is already registered. Please login or use a different email.'

use_cases.title: Attempt signup with a unique email
use_cases.goal: To verify the system allows a signup attempt with a unique, previously unregistered email
preconditions: No pre-existing users in the system
The email address newuser@example.com is not registered in the system
steps: Enter the email address 'newuser@example.com' and password 'SecurePass123!'
expected_results: Receive a 201 status code indicating account created successfully
Display success message or redirection to a success page

use_cases.title: Attempt signup with maximum valid email length
use_cases.goal: To test the system's handling of an email at the maximum valid length
preconditions: There are no pre-existing users in the system
steps: Enter the email address 'a1234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234@example.com' and password 'SecurePass123!'
expected_results: Receive a 201 status code indicating account created successfully or a validation error if the system has a lower maximum email length not specified in the provided documents
boundary_cases: Email length at the system's maximum accepted length

assumptions: Assuming the system has a maximum email length that is not specified in the provided documents, leading to potential validation error for the boundary case.
missing_information: The specific maximum email length accepted by the system is not provided.
hallucination_issues: Low confidence in output quality (score: 0.57, minimum: 0.6)
safety_warnings: Hallucination: Low confidence in output quality (score: 0.57, minimum: 0.6)
